name: Mythmaking Mechanisms in Autonomous Worlds
description: This talk explores where narrative comes from inside of systems. And how this differs from most forms of storytelling - including traditional games.

speakers.name: Jay Springett
speakers.bio:
Jay Springett strategises new worlds. With a background in corporate consulting and philosophy of arts, Jay specialises in fostering cohesive worlds through the integration of people, place, and technologies. A foundational voice in the Solarpunk movement and a passionate advocate for decentralised narratives, Jay has been an admin on solarpunks.net since 2014 and contributes to global dialogues on future, technology, and regenerative cultures. 

In 2022 Jay co-instructed The New Centreâ€™s DAO Design Fiction seminar series, and is founding member of decentralised creative exchange Guild.Is. He is a Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts. He is currently writing "The Web Was a Side Quest". A book about the past, present and future of worlds. 

His essay collection on running worlds can be found at worldrunning.guide, and his weekly 301 second long podcast at permanentlymoved.online. Jay invites you to read more at thejaymo.net.
